node.title: COVID exposure sites balloon in SA on eve of Christmas celebrations
node.alt: One entrance to the Westfield Marion store, with red neon sign, red bricks and people rushing in
node.description: Nearly 50 COVID exposure sites at 30 venues have been added to SA's ballooning list on the eve of Christmas celebrations, with all of them deemed close-contact sites — including a shop in one of the state's busiest supermarkets.
node.content: ["Nearly 50 COVID\u00a0exposure sites at 30 venues\u00a0have been added to South Australia's ballooning list on the eve of Christmas celebrations, with all of them\u00a0deemed close-contact sites by health authorities.", "In one of the most extensive updates since the state's borders reopened, 47 sites were added by SA Health late on Thursday afternoon.", "Among several concerning listings was\u00a0a\u00a0shop at Westfield Marion shopping centre in Adelaide's south.", "The Universal Store has been deemed a close-contact site on December 16, 18 and 19 for significant parts of each day.", "Early-learning and childcare centres,\u00a0nightclubs, gyms and restaurants across Adelaide have also been listed.", "The Marion Hotel was also listed as a close-contact exposure site for three consecutive days last week.", "Concerns about the speed of contact tracing efforts in SA has seen a social media page dedicated to the cause go viral.", "It comes as SA records a record 484 cases in a single day \u2014\u00a0the highest number since the pandemic began.", "Six adults and one child are in hospital, up from five people yesterday.", "State Coordinator and Police Commissioner Grant Stevens confirmed he would sign a direction tonight allowing the use of rapid antigen tests in the state.", "It means the tests will be available for purchase in South Australia from tomorrow,\u00a0but the state government has warned they won't replace the use of PCR tests.", "It said\u00a0the rapid\u00a0tests would be used for surveillance testing in people who don't have symptoms.\u00a0", "Check the table below to find all the sites and exposure windows.", "You can find information on testing site hours and the nearest site to you on the SA Health\u00a0website."]
